ANU.name: A.L. (Lynton) Jaques
interest: Geology, geochemistry and genesis of Australian diamonds.Petrology and geochemistry of Australian lamproites and kimberlites and their relationship to the lithospheric mantle.Petrology and geochemistry of Australian carbonatites and associated alkaline rocks and the formation of rare metal deposits.
ANU.biography: Dr AL (Lynton) Jaques PSM was formerly Chief Scientist at Geoscience Australia, Australia's national geoscience research and information agency. Prior to that he held a number of senior positions at Geoscience Australia and its predessors AGSO and BMR.  He led the Australian Energy Resource Assessment, an integrated scientific and economic analysis of Australia's non-renewable and renewable energy resources undertaken by Geoscience Australia and ABARES. He has published and presented widely on Australian lamproites, kimberlites and diamonds, and mineral exploration and resources.
project: The mineralogy, petrology and geochemistry of the West Kimberley lamproites, WA.
Mineralogy, petrology and geochemistry of Australian carbonatites.
The nature and evolution of the Australian lithospheric mantle.
The role of crustal recycling in the enrichment of sub-continental lithospheric mantle and the formation of lamproites and other ultrapotassic rocks.
